benchmark_details.name: RTLLM (RTL Generation with Large Language Models)
benchmark_details.overview: RTLLM is an open-source benchmark for generating design RTL with natural language instructions. It supports quantitative evaluation based on syntax correctness, functionality equivalence, and design quality metrics.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive platform for evaluating RTL design generation using natural language.

data.source: Created by the authors, consisting of 30 designs with various complexities and functionalities.
data.annotation: Ground-truth design created by human designers for comparison.

methodology.calculation: Evaluates syntax by checking synthesizability, functionality through testbench results, and design quality through PPA values after synthesis.
methodology.interpretation: A design is deemed successful if it meets the syntax, functionality, and quality goals.
methodology.baseline_results: Reference designs (ground-truth) generated by human engineers.
methodology.validation: Validation through automated scripts incorporated within the benchmark.
